tests.title: mod2-T1 — View landing page and scroll to bottom
scope: Open the app root URL (e.g. `http://localhost:8080`).
Confirm landing content loads and page can be scrolled to the bottom.
preconditions: The web app is running locally or accessible at a test URL.
steps: Start the web app (Vite dev or built server) at known URL.
Wait for main landmark elements to appear (header, hero, footer or a known `#root` element).
Programmatically scroll the page to the bottom.
Assert that the footer or bottom section is visible and contains expected text or links.
acceptanceCriteria: Page loads without JS errors.
Header/hero and footer (or bottom element) are rendered.
Scrolling completes and bottom element is visible and not hidden by loading overlays.
notes: This test is intentionally simple and fast. Use it as a smoke test in CI to detect broken builds or missing assets.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod3-T1 — View auth pages (login & register)
scope: Verify the public auth pages render required inputs and controls.
preconditions: App is reachable at test URL.
steps: Assert presence of email and password inputs and a submit button.
Assert presence of required fields and submit control.
acceptanceCriteria: Login and register pages render required inputs and buttons.
notes: Adjust selectors to match actual DOM (input name/id/class).

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod3-T2 — Verify & register new account
scope: Register a new user account via the app's registration flow.
preconditions: Tests should target a disposable test DB or use unique emails per run.
steps: On `/register`, fill the form with a new unique email (e.g. `e2e+{ts}@example.test`) and a valid password.
Wait for success notification or redirect to post-register page.
Optionally verify user exists via Supabase API.
acceptanceCriteria: Registration completes and the app presents the success state or redirects appropriately.
notes: Clean up created users via API where possible.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod3-T3 — Login with new account
scope: Sign in with newly created credentials and verify access to protected content.
preconditions: A user created by mod3-T2 exists.
steps: On `/login`, enter the newly created credentials and submit.
Wait for navigation to protected landing (`/dashboard` or similar) and assert known element (user avatar, welcome text) is present.
acceptanceCriteria: Login succeeds and protected content is accessible.
notes: Use API sessions or token-based sign-in to speed up tests where appropriate.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod3-T4 — Sign out account
scope: Verify the sign-out flow for an authenticated user.
preconditions: User is logged in (e.g., from mod3-T3 or via fixture/session setup).
steps: Trigger the sign-out action (via UI button/menu).
Assert the app navigates to `/` or `/login` and protected content is not accessible.
acceptanceCriteria: User is redirected to public area and cannot access protected routes without logging in again.
notes: Also assert that session tokens/cookies are cleared if applicable.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod4-T1 — Login as student then view dashboard
scope: Authenticate as a student and verify the student dashboard renders.
preconditions: A test student account exists.
steps: Assert dashboard widgets (e.g., 'My Enrollments' card) are visible.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard loads and expected widgets are present.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod4-T2 — Login as student then view profile
scope: Verify that the student's profile page renders and shows expected fields.
preconditions: Student account exists and is logged in.
steps: Assert name/email and editable fields are present.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile renders and shows expected user data.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod4-T3 — Login as student then view personal enrollments
scope: Verify the student's personal enrollments page.
preconditions: Student account with enrollments or known empty state.
steps: Assert enrollments table or empty state is displayed.
acceptanceCriteria: Enrollments list or empty-state message is present and correct.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

scope: Verify the student's payment history page.

acceptanceCriteria: Payments page renders and shows records or valid empty state.

criteria.name: understandability

criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

acceptanceCriteria: Balance summary is present and numeric fields displayed properly.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

criteria.name: understandability

criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

scope: Verify students list/table for registrar role.
preconditions: Registrar account exists; students seeded or empty-state known.
steps: Assert table headers and at least one row or valid empty state.
acceptanceCriteria: Students table or empty-state present.

tests.title: mod5-T3 — Login as registrar then view courses page
scope: Verify courses list/table for registrar.

acceptanceCriteria: Courses page renders and lists data or shows a valid empty state.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod5-T4 — Login as registrar then view subjects page
scope: Verify subjects list/table for registrar.

acceptanceCriteria: Subjects page renders or shows a correct empty state.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod6-T1 — Login as accounting then view staff dashboard
scope: Authenticate as accounting role and verify staff dashboard renders.
preconditions: Accounting account exists.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard loads with expected accounting widgets.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod6-T2 — Login as accounting then view students table
scope: Verify students list/table for accounting role.
preconditions: Accounting account exists.
acceptanceCriteria: Students table or empty-state present.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod6-T3 — Login as accounting then view payments
scope: Verify the accounting role can access the payments page and view payment records or a valid empty state.
preconditions: An accounting test user exists and can sign in.
steps: Sign in as the accounting test user.
Navigate to `/payments` (via sidebar or direct URL).
Assert that the payments list/table renders, including headers for date, amount, and payer.
If no payments exist, assert a clear empty-state message is shown.
acceptanceCriteria: Payments page renders and shows either a list/table with rows or a valid empty state.
notes: Use table header assertions rather than row counts to keep the test stable.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod6-T4 — Login as accounting then view balances
scope: Verify the accounting role can access the balances/summary page and see account balances and filters.
preconditions: An accounting test user exists and can sign in.
steps: Sign in as the accounting test user.
Navigate to `/balances` (via sidebar or direct URL).
Assert that the balances summary and numeric fields render, and filters (date range, student selector) are available if applicable.
acceptanceCriteria: Balances page shows summary information and relevant controls; numeric fields display properly.
notes: If the page uses async loading, wait for summary elements rather than fixed timeouts.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod7-T1 — Login as admin then view staff dashboard
scope: Authenticate as admin and verify staff dashboard renders and admin widgets are present.
preconditions: Admin account exists.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin dashboard renders and shows expected components.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?

tests.title: mod7-T2 — Login as admin then view registrar pages
scope: Verify admin has access to registrar pages (`/students`, `/courses`).
preconditions: Admin account exists.
steps: Assert pages render and expected UI elements are present.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can access registrar pages without permission errors.

criteria.name: understandability
criteria.label: Understandability
criteria.description: Could a new user understand the flow quickly?
